net.sf.mmm.client.ui.api.common

Class Length

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.util.lang.api.AbstractDatatype
      • net.sf.mmm.util.lang.api.AbstractSimpleDatatypeBase<String>
        • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.api.common.Length
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, AttributeReadValue<String>, Datatype, SimpleDatatype<String>

    public class Length
extends AbstractSimpleDatatypeBase<String>
    This is the Datatype for a Length. It typically represents a width or height of a UI-object. Therefore it consists of two parts:
    • an amount
    • a unit
    Examples:
    getValue() getAmount() getUnit()
    12px 12.0 LengthUnit.PIXEL
    100% 100.0 LengthUnit.PERCENT
    0.8em 0.8 LengthUnit.EM
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)
    See Also:
    LengthUnit.newLength(double), Serialized Form

      • getValue

        public String getValue()

        Returns:
        the value of this datatype.

      • getAmount

        public double getAmount()
        This method gets the value (amount) of this size. Is to be interpreted in the according unit.
        Returns:
        the actual value of this Length.

      • getUnit

        public LengthUnit getUnit()
        This method gets the unit of the value.

        the LengthUnit.

      • convertToPixel

        public double convertToPixel(double basePixelLength,
                             LengthProperty property)
        This method gets the amount in pixels.
        ATTENTION:
        This implementation is NOT precise and should only used when you know what you are doing.
        Parameters:
        basePixelLength - is the base length in pixel used to convert from percent. Use 0 if unknown (what will result in 0 in case of percent length values).
        property - is the LengthProperty or null if not available.
        Returns:
        the length in pixels.

      • valueOfPercent

        public static Length valueOfPercent(double amount)
        Creates a new Length with unit LengthUnit.PERCENT.
        Parameters:
        amount - is the amount.
        Returns:
        the new Length.
